oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MEASUREMENTS OF WAVE BREAKING IN THE UK COASTAL RESEARCH FACILITY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Southgate, Howard N.
Stripling, Stuart
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave breaking
breaking measurements
UK Coastal Research Facility
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Many experiments have been carried out on wave breaking in the past, but these have mainly been for regular, normally-incident waves. This paper describes experiments in the UK Coastal Research Facility in which over a hundred separate tests were carried out, covering regular, random, normally-incident, angled and multidirectional waves. Measurements were made of wave parameters as the waves underwent breaking in shallow water on a 1:20 slope. Analysis of the data to determine the wave breaking criterion, y, for three random wave categories is presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 25 (1996): Proceedings of 25th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Orlando, Florida, 1996.
